parsedComplaintsResult.issueCategory: Adhesive Failure of Coolant Pipe Fittings
parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the adhesive bonding the coolant pipe fittings can cause a catastrophic loss of engine coolant, leading to overheating, engine damage, and potentially loss of vehicle control, which can result in accidents or injuries.
symptoms: steam or smoke emanating from the engine compartment
coolant leaking onto the rear tires

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the engine coolant lines can cause the engine to overheat, leading to costly repairs and potentially causing accidents due to slick coolant on the tires.
symptoms: coolant on rear wheels and tires

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: The failure of the manual transmission can cause the transmission to pop out of gear, leading to a loss of control and potentially causing accidents, especially during deceleration and cornering.
symptoms: Transmission popping out of second gear upon deceleration

parsedComplaintsResult.impact: Sudden coolant loss can cause the engine to overheat, leading to engine damage, loss of vehicle control, and potential accidents, posing a risk to the driver and other road users.
symptoms: Sudden and catastrophic failure of coolant hoses or water manifold connections
